intro: Recchia bracteata, commonly known as the bracteate recchia, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley. The plant is characterized by its slender, upright stems and small, greenish-white flowers that bloom in clusters. Its leaves are finely divided and aromatic, often used in traditional herbal remedies. Recchia bracteata is typically found in rocky soils and dry environments, thriving in full sun.
